intro: Pseudopanax discolor, commonly known as the New Zealand clubmoss, is a unique plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pseudopannaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant has a short, stocky stem with dense, scale-like leaves that give it a moss-like appearance. It is a perennial evergreen that thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and protected species.
